column2: Do you ever have trouble organising data?
column3: If yes to the above, what is the exact issue you have with organising data?
column4: Is this an issue that could be solved by a desktop/mobile application?
column5: Why are you having this issue?
column6: How could this issue be solved?

column3: its to hard for me to always sort my download files or even when doing a project sorting the data and differentiating it form other sets of data
column5: cause at school I will get loaded with information and need to either sort it or use it and sorting my data takes to much time when I need to be focusing o my project
column6: by using a system to sort all your items alphabetically or sort into different folder titles the fit the title of your document

column5: because i have to many things and not enough space

column3: its hard to find places to put data and find appropriate ways to display it
column5: i am not good at organizing data myself
column6: i could use a digital outcome such as a website to give me an intuitive way to organize my data

column5: I don't have an issue organising data.
column6:
You could have an application ie a reminder app that reminds the user that their data needed to be organised in a way that it is easy to track, update, modify etc. 
Or you could develop an app that could (similar to a reminder app), but it is like a pop up message that will remind you to move the data to its appropriate foldern etc.

column3: Sometimes there's just too much to organise easily
column4: potentially, but the application would end up having direct access into the devices' files and could be exploited
column5: because school makes lots of files that quickly become difficult to organise
column6: a way to organise data alphabetically, chronologically, or categorically and make it easier to delete data that isnt needed.
